meanings.definition: A half step in music, the smallest interval between two notes.
meanings.sent1: In music class, we learned that a semitone is the distance between two adjacent piano keys.
meanings.sent2: The musician adjusted the pitch by a semitone to make the melody sound just right.
meanings.sent3: The semitone between the two notes was so tiny, it felt like a secret musical code.
meanings.sent4: Her voice rose a semitone higher, reaching into the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The semitone added a touch of mystery to the haunting melody.

meanings.definition: A small unit of measurement equal to half a tone.
meanings.sent1: The ruler showed a semitone marking, indicating half the length of a full tone.
meanings.sent2: He measured the fabric with precision, down to the smallest semitone.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for a semitone of salt, just a pinch to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist mixed colors with a semitone of blue, creating a subtle shade for the painting.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter used a semitone measurement to ensure the perfect fit of the wooden pieces.
